Trait description: The plants tolerance to Aluminium.
Method description: Use formula to calculate Aluminium tolerance index. Entries with indices above 1 are more resistant than the average genotype in the experiment and entries with indices less than 1 have below average tolerance.

Trait description: Chlorophyll content in leaf green tissue. Includes both chlorophyll-a and chlorophyll-b.
Method description: The chlorophyll content of leaves (and other green tissues) can be quickly, and non-destructively measured using a hand-held battery portable optical meter (e.g., Minolta SPAD-502 chlorophyll meter) which measures the chlorophyll content via light transmittance (absorbance of red light at 650 nm and infrared light at 940 nm) and compensates for differing leaf thicknesses. Readings from the instrument are not absolute chlorophyll values, instead each reading is a ?chlorophyll concentration index? (CCI, ranging from 0 to 99.9). Measurements are typically made on selected/marked leaf (once fully expanded), although measurements of lower leaves may be taken to assess canopy chlorophyll profiles.

Trait description: Length of fully mature leaves from ligule to leaf tip (exclude flowering stems).
Method description: Measure leaf length and record it.

Trait description: Width of fully mature leaves at the widest part.
Method description: Measure leaf width and record it.

Trait description: The plant diameter.
Method description: Plant diameter is measured at the widest and most narrow point of the plant crown, and the average is recorded.
